Reviews.Title: “memphis graceland”
Reviews.Author: illustratedmum33
Reviews.Content: A refreshed motel.Looks good overall..a fridge and microwave and hairdryer and iron. big queen size bed which was comfy and clean. The downside are that the sink drain doesn't drain and the plug won't fit the bath. A vast improvement from motel 6 downtown. We purchased a gorgeous sandwhich from the deli across the road. I would advise again just to watch the area at night as the liquor store has bars on it and a few bad people around.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jordan262
Reviews.Content: Great motel. Rooms are basic but clean, quiet, and comfortable. Staff is friendly. My only complaint was that my room was missing bath towels. They seemed to be having some kind of issue with their linen supplier that caused this, but they were able to bring some to me from an unoccupied room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: daniel_m84
Reviews.Content: For anyone heading to Graceland, this is a great budget stay. The rooms are quite large, and very clean. Beds are motel 6 standard and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay and we booked already for next year 2012”
Reviews.Author: ken y
Reviews.Content: i brought a bus tour from wisc and stayed at the motel 6,airport/ graceland.our rooms were nice and the staff went way out of their to make sure our stay was a safe and pleasant one.we were there for elvis week 2011. i just booked for elvis week 2012, at the same location,thank you motel 6 for all your help and looking foreward to next august 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurIntrepide
Reviews.Content: This is the first Motel 6 we've used on our 10-week road trip and it was very good. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. I made this reservation because the WiFi was free and we travel with 3 netbooks. I'm getting fed up with paying for the WiFi in this chain because at $2.99 each the cost exceeds the cost of the stay in other motels. Nowhere on the website does it say they charge for each computer so we've managed to argue the extra charge at Reception but it gets annoying having to get cross with them. However, it was free and we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the price, but...”
Reviews.Author: dgrbleu2
Reviews.Content: I was very, very surprised by this hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable and seemed to be new, plenty of fluffy bathtowels, decent lighting, coffee/tea in-room, mini-fridge and microwave, hairdryer, free wi-fi, etc... The furnishings and carpet were a little on the tired side, but in this price category, the hotel delivered way more than I expected as far as what the room was equipped with and had to offer. There is an outdoor pool, but it was not yet open for business at the end of April. The area around the hotel is desolate and industrial, but the other hotels nearby are in the same situation. Free breakfast was OK, biscuits and gravy very good, as was the coffee. Otherwise, there was some fresh fruit pieces and toast and cereal. The waffle maker was cold, so not sure if it was faulty or only used at certain times of the year. The one drawback, and it was a huge drawback, is that the hotel walls were terribly thin. I rang the front desk in the night about the room next door as I could hear the whole conversation and I thought they were being too loud. However, in the morning I could hear TV's, other conversations, etc. So I think it is just thin walls. My Mom slept fine, I did not, so this was a huge issue for me. If you are not sensitive to the possibility of overhearing folks in the next room, and are looking for a budget room that delivers beyond expectations, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCouple24
Reviews.Content: I will make this brief, but the drains do not work which is just annoying with standing water while you shower and water in the sink while you brush your teeth. Also, my wife found a screw in her cereal this morning at the breakfast in the lobby. I informed the lady that was working with the breakfast area, and little to no concern was shown. I was told "It probably fell out of the cereal dispenser." It must happen all the time.

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: Eliane21
Reviews.Content: I was in Memphis to the last Elvis' Week and I loved my stay in this hotel. People very friendly and very honesty. My English is poor and all the front desk help so much with all things that I needed. So close of Graceland. I will make reservation to the next year in the same hotel, certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel - literally”
Reviews.Author: Pochacolee
Reviews.Content: I think people that favorably review this motel must confuse it with the other Quality Inn in Memphis. That is the only way it can be rated this well. It is dirty, old, run down, poorly maintained, next door to a strip club and at 11pm, in the airports flight pattern. Ridiculous. Even the pillows are pathetic tiny toss pillows, not standard pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: dajo82
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant enough. They advertise 'deluxe' breakfast.- it was in no way deluxe. Situated next door to strip club, didn't feel very safe. Room was just ok. Unless you can sleep like a rock, you won't want to stay here. Airplanes were flying directly overhead all night- very loud. If you can sleep through that, this hotel would be ok for one night of sleep. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GregSpeersOrch11
Reviews.Content: This place has a fantastic atmosphere and the staff are friendly and helpful. We travelled to America to visit Memphis and experience the culture within. Everyone in this place was everything you would want from hotel staff. They showed all the willing to help us with everything we needed and more. The place was clean and the rooms were up to a good standard. The Location is under a flight path which some may find difficult to deal with but it is in the title of the place. You can't expect to be that close to the airport and not hear planes! Also, as the name suggests, it is situated close to Graceland and Elvis Presley Boulevard which is the road to everywhere in the city. The reason I have rated this place as excellent is primarily because of the charachters of the staff within. It is a family run hotel with staff that are understanding. There was a group of 11 of us in all that were all there to have a good time. The staff realised this and on more than one occasion joined in on our gatherings. Everything about this place is what I would want from a hotel from situation to staff. STRONGLY RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quality Inn quality”
Reviews.Author: Scudderbutter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Quality Inns, in fact they are my chain of choice. This one is in the bottom half of the list so far. This is an ok motel for a nights sleep and a shower, but nothing special. My sink drain didn't work until I crawled underneath to raise the stopper. The room was moderately clean but was showing its age. I was in Memphis for Memphis in May, and an employee set me up with a driver to go downtown. The driver said it was 15.00 one way or 25.00 round trip and he would pick me up when I was ready to come home. So I paid him 25.00 and he took me down just fine, but when it was time to come home, the jerk didn't answer his phone. The cabs cost around 17.00 to go to Beale Street and I recommend them. The employees were professional and friendly enough and the breakfast was typical Quality Inn waffles and biscuits and gravy. The airport transportation was fairly prompt and was very handy. I wouldn't have stayed at this motel without it. I talked them into giving me a free lift to Graceland which is only a few blocks away and worth the 2-4 hours it takes to go on the tour. There is then a free shuttle to Sun Studios. This is worth the time also. If you go to Mempis and can fit in these two tours, take them. This motel is located between 2 strip joints, while it really didn't bother me, it may some people. I didn't see any strange people wandering around after dark and actually felt pretty safe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Come Here Because Of Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: Pepesmom
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for myself, another person and my dog. I clearly made this known and was quoted a price which I agreed to and I paid with a major credit card over the phone. When I checked out they charged me extra cash because of my dog! What a joke! I cannot recommend a place that lies to you! Stay Away!

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: carole13
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful experience when I stayed at the Quality In/Airport/Memphis, TN. The man named Neil arranged for my sister and I to take a wonderful tour of Memphis. They picked us up in the morning and brought us back six hours later. It was perfect. There was a lovely breakfast provided each morning in the lobby. Everything was very clean, and the people were so friendly. I would highly recommend this motel to anyone who is planning a trip to Memphis. The location is great, and it was just an all around wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Price - Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: bcs2008
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel if you don't mind not having fancy new amenities. It was a good price and a place to sleep with a nice staff. The wireless internet was great, the beds were a little hard and the pillows flat but what do you expect. This a great overnight hotel, I don't think I would stay here more than two nights just because the bed was hard and the blankets were not very warm but again if you bring your own it doesn't matter. We were able to have the Pink Cadalliac from Marlow's pick us up right at our door which was really cool for my grandmother and our kids. Now if you are really picky about your surrounding area and newer hotel do not stay here, it is an older hotel and it has been used. It is a 1/2 block from a gentlemen's club but we did not notice any issues, noise or weird people but we also were not out after 10:00 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: gregwhiz
Reviews.Content: Just remember, you get what you pay for. The hotel is a place to sleep and clean up. There is a pool but not much else. The room was clean and the bed comfortable enough for sleep. The hotel is close to the airport so it is noisy from time to time. However, if you are looking for an economical place to stay that is close to Graceland and close to downtown, then this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad even for a "2 Star”
Reviews.Author: jforbes01
Reviews.Content: All you need to know: Strippers right next door. Directly under an approach/departure route for the airport (Aircraft less than 1000' over hotel). Normally this is ok with me but Memphis airport seems to run 24/7 so yes at 2-6AM there are still jets overhead every ~3 min. Even after the front desk had my ID, CC and confirmed my booking they wouldn't let me past the foyer to check in at the desk. I had to slide everything under the plexiglass. Granted we checked in late at night but it still says a lot about the place. Despite booking a non-smoking room we were given a smoking room and it reeked. Cheaper rate when walking in than hotels.com rate(likely correlates to the smoking room). The pet rate was higher than we were told when booking. The room/bed/bathroom were about average for the price level.

Reviews.Title: “Break-In”
Reviews.Author: flashypatty
Reviews.Content: We got there on Friday to take my mom to see here sister who was getting ready to pass away. When we got there we did not have enough blankets and I went down and asked for two at 3:00 that afternoon. Went down 2 more times before we finally got two at 9:30 that evening. We went to the continental breakfast the next morning that consisted of nothing more than toast and some stall donuts that came out of a vending machine and a jar of orange juice that hair all around the inside of the top and when told, the young lady just wiped the top and put it back on the juice. After the breakfast we went to the hospital only to get back and find our room had been broke in and $700.00 missing. The manager never came to talk to us or reinburst us for our time there. The worst time we ever had in any hotel. Our bags were locked up.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: winnie32
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Memphis during Elvis week. Stayed from Sat to Mon. Service was great. Room was nice and clean as was the bathroom. The planes were not bad except for Mon. night only night that I heard them. Is next door to a topless bar but felt safe. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: NCD0003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the Southern Heritage Classic weekend. There is a small sign posted at the desk stating that since the hotel is close to the airport, that planes fly over the hotel. Well I did not know that it meant I would be able to see the passengers in their seats. The planes fly directly over the hotel from the runway, so they are close enough to read the side of the plane. Flights leave at all hours, so the noise was ridiculous. The neighborhood is not very good. The room was crappy. We left on Saturday morning at 9:00 to see the sights. Upon returning at 1:00, our room was not done. The maid was outside and happened to be walking by (she had passed our room) and asked if we wanted our rooms cleaned? We had to ask for fresh towels. The shuttle did not work. There was nothing enjoyable about our stay. I would not recommend staying there. There are also strip clubs within the same block.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: geminicube
Reviews.Content: We booked this room over the Internet and arrived to be quite surprised. The hotel has changed to a Quality Inn and Suites. All the rooms have outdoor access, which isn't a big deal, but the area of town wasn't the greatest. The room was clean, but pretty gross at the same time. The bathroom smelled bad and you could just tell the place was old. It looked like they were trying to renovate, though, so it might not be too bad after that is done. We walked in and walked straight back out to the front desk and cancelled our room. The girls at the from desk were extremely nice and understanding. We did not feel comfortable staying here, but maybe after some changes it will be okay.

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hands down the worst hotel I have ever been too in my life! Located in a horrible area. I had to be buzzed into the lobby, for "safety" reasons. The bathroom was dirty, the bedsheets and blankets smelled. There were 3 burned out lights in my room, only 2 were fixed. The door looked like it had been kicked in. The "manager on duty" was uncooperative, rude and refused to tell me her full name, or the actual managers name or the name of anyone that could assist me. I checked in, and 2 hours later I checked out!

Reviews.Title: “loved the place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff here is very wonderful. The ladies at the front desk both morning and afternoon are very nice and helpful. The breakfast hostess was friendly and attentive. The rooms very cozy and clean. We had a very enjoyable stay Will definitly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcguy3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights. The room was clean and adequate in size. Maintenance of the room was pretty good. The hotel is located not too far from Graceland. It is close to a couple of rather seedy establishments on Brooks Road. The hotel looked like it was more than half empty when I stayed there. The bad part of my stay occurred on the last night before I checked out. At around 3 AM a piercing siren could be heard outside. I wasn't sure if the place was fire or what. After about 15 mintues, the siren stopped. Suffice to say that wrecked my sleep that night. Also, when I went to eat at the continental breakfast area in the morning, there was very little left to eat. I would not recommend this place to stay if you are in the area. There are many other better alternatives.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Memphis - Graceland
HotelInfo.Address: 1581 Brooks Rd., Memphis, TN 38116 (Formerly Quality Inn Airport/Graceland)
